page.title: 07SHERIFF HUTTON COMMUNICATION
page.content: Our link with the rest of the country is by car,bus,newspaper,phone, television.Three buses a day connect the village with York.Cars are the main means of transport,this includes voluntary help by car with hospital and sick visiting,our nearest main hospital being York.A local 'Village News'is printed and delivered to every house once a mounth,all the work is done by volunteers,giving news of events and reports on village affairs. National newspapers are delivered by the milkman (a.m) paperboys (p.m.) or available at two of the shops.Most houses have telephones.There are two public 'phone boxes.Postal delivery for a large area is centred on the village post office,five postmen delivering.Collection from two post boxes is made daily.There are two school buses.
